intro: Strychnos bicirrhosa, commonly known as the two-veined strychnos, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with two distinct veins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange-red berries containing seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its toxic properties, it is typically avoided by livestock and humans.
